question: Which state government has decided to set up museum at the house of Ishwar Chandra Vidyasagar?
explanation: The West Bengal government has decided to set up a museum at the north Kolkata house of 19th century social reformer Ishwar Chandra Vidyasagar where he had spent the last few years of his life. The museum chronicles his life from his birth place at Birsinghapur village in Paschim Medinipur district to the house in north Kolkata. He  was a key figure of the Bengal Renaissance and the most prominent campaigner for Hindu widow remarriage.
